intro: Syncolostemon lanceolatus var. grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered synoclostemon, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
